website_summaries.verdict: A good machine for those who don't want frills and loads of extra stitches, but it gets the job done without a hassle or added cost.
pros: All the basics are here with a solid metal frame built to last
6 basic stitches work beautifully to cut down on beginner frustration
Manual dials make it sweet and simple
cons: Threading can be a challenge, even with the instruction booklet

website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive machine that does the basics well. This no-frills model is best for those who plan on only occasional use.
pros: With 6 built-in stitches and an automatic buttonhole, it works well for basic sewing
Simple to use and no frills design is perfect for beginners
cons: Threading can be a challenge even with the instruction booklet

customer_reviews.title: Great basic sewing machine
customer_reviews.text: Love this little sewing machine! Back into sewing after a 30 year hiatus, I was looking for a simple machine to replace my old, heavy one. I first bought a lightweight Brother, but it made me want to throw it out the window. I love the smooth action, the small size, and ease of use. The tension was correct right out of the box, unlike the Brother machine, which I could never adjust correctly. There are only 6 stitches, but that is more than adequate for my needs. A truly great basic sewing machine.
customer_reviews.author: Crazygrandma

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I am completely happy with this purchase. A month ago I made a commitment to learn to sew and with this machine I have already done many projects. It is very easy to use and perfect for beginners. I have been able to fix mine and my husband's jeans and make scarves for winter and make a caddy for my sewing machine. I am very entertaining doing things with my machine. It was an excellent investment.
customer_reviews.author: IsiJ

customer_reviews.title: Not easy for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: The best part about this machine is that it’s very solid. The base is robust. I’m not a sewing expert by any means, but I know my way around enough. I had to adjust the bobbin tension which was annoying. The machine also unthreads itself easily. Probably the worst part is the pedal. I have to apply quite a bit of pressure to get it to go, which often results in a jolt of stitches. I wouldn’t recommend and will probably by another machine when i have the budget for it.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Rambo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for sewing newbies or small projects! Bought this for my daughter and it's perfect! I'll also be using to take to Girl Scout meetings to see badges
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Davenport

customer_reviews.title: Nice even stitching and relatively goof proof
customer_reviews.text: This is a relatively simple beginners machine. Although I needed about 7 you tube videos to figure out how to thread the machine, this is not because the machine is difficult but because I have ZERO sewing skills. My eight year old figured it out in about 5 minutes. Nice even stitching and relatively goof proof.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Terrible machine!
customer_reviews.text: Huge disappointment! The bobbin mechanism is totally ridiculous - there’s nothing to keep the bobbin in place, so after you spend a solid 45 minutes trying to get the damn bobbin threaded, it pops out and jams the machine after only a few stitches. Absolute piece of garbage, would not recommend by any stretch of the imagination!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: The bobbin is worthless!
customer_reviews.text: I had a basic Singer from 1968 for about 40 years; never a problem. To return to basic sewing, I selected this one. What a big mistake! That bobbin is totally useless. Plus, they've changed ever so slightly the size of the new bobbins so you have to buy all new ones. After all these years, and with competition from other brands, why on earth change from a visible drop-in bobbin to something requiring an engineering degree? I've had more trouble getting this machine to function without exhausting every dirty word I know. I would trash it & buy a decent machine if I trusted Singer again. DON'T BUY ONE!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: If this is the way to learn you want to find another hobby - fast!
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of junk. The thing jams repeatedly for no apparent reason. I tried adjusting the tension on both the top and the bottom spools, making sure the fabric was free from loose threads under the foot, making sure nothing was caught anywhere else, threaded correctly, etc. If you look at the troubleshooting in the owner's manual it doesn't give a reason as to why it would jam, it just tells you how to correct it (like, again and again and again). Not fun.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: do not bother buying this machine
customer_reviews.text: Ordered one- jamming over and over, sent back .second one worked okay for awhile and whole bobbin apparatus popped out, could not repair. sent back..Made in China!!!Singer is going to go out of business with the lack of quality! But who can afford a Bernina that starts $999?
customer_reviews.author: pam kneebone

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use for beginners. I just made my daughter’s dress using this machine.
customer_reviews.author: snowhite

customer_reviews.title: It is a hot mess! Not for the newbie seamstress 😞
customer_reviews.text: The bobbin mechanism causes totally loose stitches with a mess on the underside. Threading it diagram totally confusing I ourchasrd a while ago and just had time to unbox and try out - ugh! Now it’s too late to return Not a beginner machine
customer_reviews.author: Patti

customer_reviews.title: very recommended for beginners
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT. It was my first time ever using a sewing machine so the instructions for how to put the string were not that easy to understand, but I looked for a video on YouTube that helped me a lot and on the same day I managed to sew my first item, a soft blanket for a baby. My mom has the professional machine (the old metal ones) and I can tell there is a great difference in the capabilities of sewing different fabrics but for me it was enough.
customer_reviews.author: Mori Amitai

customer_reviews.title: Not good for someone who had been sewing for sometime
customer_reviews.text: I got this hoping the quality of the stitches would be decent for using it as a travel machine. I love my other Singer sewing machines and was looking for something basic for piecing quilt tops when traveling. No matter what I did the stitches sucked. I have been quilting for years and just didn’t want to pack my more expensive machines around.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Wynter

customer_reviews.title: Question
customer_reviews.text: I just have a question. I’m a beginner sewing and iv been using this machine for a few days now and it seems like every time I stop the machine and start it going again the thread always gets caught In the machine *reference the pic* I don’t know if it’s something I’m doing wrong myself or if it’s the machine? Any information would help, thank you. Other than that I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Keith Morris jr

customer_reviews.title: Made 15 virus masks within 4 hours of being delivered!
customer_reviews.text: Sewing machine is so easy to use. Just what I needed. None of the extra options I would never use & paid extra for! Plugged the machine in, starting sewing instantly. Had been making the masks by hand - two hours each, until my new machine was delivered. Old Singer machine will go to repair shop once Pandemic is over!
customer_reviews.author: debs

customer_reviews.title: Sewing machine was opened before.
customer_reviews.text: I got this last Sunday 6/11 and was getting ready to use it today 6/17. I opened the box and it has a loose part that I have no idea where it goes, it's missing the bobbins, the all purpose foot and a few more accessories. Really disappointed with these product. It looks like this was opened before since the plastic bag with the accessories had already been opened. Ready to return it!
customer_reviews.author: Saraemont

customer_reviews.title: Watch the Singer vídeos... much better than the paper instructions.
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived 2 days before it was scheduled. It had everything inside. It worked fantastic. I marked easy to use a 4 of 5 stars because it was the first time I ever used a sewing machine and the paper instructions were not as helpful as I thought they would be. I used Singer videos and another video on YouTube and I was sewing within 10 minutes after unboxing the product. It is very easy to use. If you a novice, this is a great machine with start with. Easy to learn and a great cost
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Font

customer_reviews.title: Not overly complex but not as easy as I'd like
customer_reviews.text: The machine isn't bad but as someone with absolutely NO experience I was hoping for something that didn't require reading an instruction book and squinting over diagrams. Even the really short "quick start guide" diagram was a hard to follow. In short the machine doesn't have a lot of extras which is nice but don't expect to just take it out of the box, look at it and be ready to go if you have never had to thread a sewing machine before.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: We bought this product for my daughter who wanted to learn how to sew; unfortunately my Mom who was going to teach her didn't get to work with her until this last weekend so past the ability to return the product for a refund. My Mom who has many years of experience told me after multiple needles breaking and the machine jamming that this is the worst machine she has ever used. I will be writing Singer directly to see if we can return it to them for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Philip A. Hasterok

customer_reviews.title: Not so great
customer_reviews.text: Was very disappointed that all the major pieces on the top are made of plastic. The pressure foot and levers all plastic. Can't see this lasting long. I had a brother sewing machine I when I was twelve and have it to this day. The settings are off and need adjustments all the time. The entire sewing machine is steel and metal parts. I didn't open it right away so by the time I did, I it was too late to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Beginner sewing machine
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine to learn how to sew, knowing I needed to learn basic stitches. I find the machine easy to use, straightforward and fun to sew with. Found the thread cutter on the side a few times after using the machine. I would recommend it for someone just learning how to sew.
customer_reviews.author: KD_SECT

customer_reviews.title: Says for beginners but I, who have been sewing ...
customer_reviews.text: Says for beginners but I , who have been sewing on a machine for 35 years, couldn't figure out how to put the bobbin in .Putting the bobbin in is about a 10 step process. Then it wouldn't catch when I tried sewing. I tried for over an hour messing with the thing. There is no way my 10 year old is going to get how to do it.
customer_reviews.author: Stacie P.

customer_reviews.title: Don't do it!
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea how this machine has such a great rating. At least it's cheaper now! I've had it for almost 2 year and seriously, all it does is jam at the bobbin. It is extremely frustrating and Im upset I wasted my money on it. Again, I've had this thing for almost 2 years and I'm not a beginner either, I am still having problems with it so it's not me, it's the machine. Please please please find a different one to buy so you dont end up like me, with a machine that sucks, $$$ lost, and extremely frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Not great for beginners.  Needle getting stuck repeatedly
customer_reviews.text: After reading the lovely reviews I wanted to give it a try but realized that it's Not great for beginners. Needle is getting stuck repeatedly
customer_reviews.author: Dr.SKo

customer_reviews.title: Great first sewing machine
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the machine so I could make masks for the Covid19 outbreak. I've never had a sewing machine so I wanted to get a simple beginners machine. As others noted they do not provide an instruction manual however the quick start up sheet does provide the website to view the manual online. There are plenty of YouTube videos to assist with using the machine. Truly a great first machine. Not very complicated to use. Would highly recommend to any first time buyers.
customer_reviews.author: AngelReznor

customer_reviews.title: Not a very good machine.
customer_reviews.text: Having been a sewer for many years, I was looking for something simple and easy to use. I chose Singer because I had many machines over the years. This one is very simple, no problem. The problem is to change bobbins you must remove the free arm, no simple task. On using it the first time, the light flickers on and off, mostly off. The bobbin winder is bad. You must hold the thread to get tension on it or the bobbin thread is loose and a mess. Over all, I would not recommend this machine to a beginner as they would become very frustrated. I am not happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Patti Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Totally dissatisfied with this sewwing machine
customer_reviews.text: The sewing machine constantly jams the bobbin and breaks needles. After the bobbin jams you clear the jam it runs a little and then jams again. After that the needles break, All The needles that were included with the machine have broken so I purchased heavier duty needles The Bobbin continues to jam and these needles break as well What is worse is that their return policy. You cnnot return if it is open or used. How do you know if it is a good product unless you use it? You should be aware of this before you purchase. Manufacturer has not returned requests or calls
customer_reviews.author: Robert C.

customer_reviews.title: Foot Pedal power cord is too heavy or it would get 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Lightweight, Easy to use, Basic Stitches, Nice LED light and worked well. Con: The foot pedal. The cord which is split with the power cord is very heavy and was impossible to get the kinks out. As a result the foot pedal almost hovered off the table no matter how low my table way. I found myself chasing the foot pedal and fighting it. I found a replacement foot pedal for $19.99 on Amazon and it works so much better than the original. I plan to share my concern with Singer because this is a simple manufacturing fix.
customer_reviews.author: gr8fitgal

customer_reviews.title: User friendly, great beginner sewing machine
customer_reviews.text: Love it! So easy to use. I used to sew a long time ago and just started again. So glad that I got this model. It's so user friendly. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a sewing machine for beginners or people like me who don't want a complicated sewing machine. Such a great price for a great quality made sewing machine
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a solid beginner machine for your budding seamstresses and tailors!
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for our 6 year old granddaughter, who is very interested in sewing. It is a very nice machine with basic features. The price is outstanding for the quality of the machine. Her Dad is teaching her how to make basic items like pillows. Adult supervision definitely required at all times!
customer_reviews.author: NPR MANTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Not for beginners!
customer_reviews.text: What a waste of money! My daughter and I gave up trying to sew with it. I even had a very experienced seamstress look it over and not even she could make it work. Here is the bottom line: The instructions are difficult to understand for a beginner, Not user friendly, difficult to learn Flimsy and lightweight ( appears to broken after two attempts to use it) I would not recommend this sewing machine to anyone - regardless of the sewing skill
customer_reviews.author: A.Z.

customer_reviews.title: NEEDLE KEEPS BREAKING ( Do not Buy this Machine!)
customer_reviews.text: Im in the believe I got an old sewing machine. The worst part is they don't give you enough time to return or exchange it. I just started using it from the date I bought it and it has been hell for me. By now Im not able to exchange as I hadn't started using until recent. Im so upset as Ive to be buy needle every other day. I cant even back stitch, Once I do it the needle bends, bends and then breaks. it is so unfair and they need to have a way where we as customers can get the issue fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Makeda

customer_reviews.title: Thread keeps popping and bobbin thread gets tangled. Took ...
customer_reviews.text: Thread keeps popping and bobbin thread gets tangled. Took sewing class and instructor had issues with it as well.
customer_reviews.author: shay malvo

customer_reviews.title: I liked the machine
customer_reviews.text: I liked the machine, however the manual is not user friendly and I was only able to string the machine after viewing a tutorial on YouTube. I have only used at the initial set up. Will update my review later. Update: The thread keeps jamming or oil keeps coming out on the fabric. Too late and costly to return.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Took it out the box and it doesn't work. Really dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: Would give 0 stars if i could. I bought this for my wife she didn't have time to use it right away but when the pandemic started she wanted to make some masks and when she tried to use it it didn't work. the machine just makes a buzzing sound and doesn't sew it was a huge disappointment and more so because i try contacting the support team by phone and mail without any results so now im stuck with it and it doesn't work i don't recommend anybody buying this since they cant even pick up the phone to help the costumers
customer_reviews.author: Lovo Jr.

customer_reviews.title: A great beginners sewing machine!
customer_reviews.text: My 11ys old LOVES IT!!!! it's a bit hard to thread a needle and quite hard to change a bobbin with no prior experience and she lost interest in it right away because of it. I head to bring her back to try it again. But with some support from an experienced adult, it's very manageable. It requires a lot of patience to manage. We used the online videos to help us out trouble shooting...But once you figured it out, It's a great machine for a beginner sewer and an amazing gift as a first time sewing machine! I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Spent four hours trying to get my wife’s previous sewing machine to work. Gave up and bought this. She sews maybe three times a year. Needed something basic, easy to understand and get through some thick material like denim and canvas. Worked like a charm. Already came threaded out of the box. Did a couple test runs - good thing she did because there was some residual oil on the needle. Boom! Finished her heavy drapes in about 15 minutes. Also nice and light compared to what we replaced. We know next to nothing about sewing but if you need something basic this sure fits the bill.
customer_reviews.author: DAF

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly happy with this simple, ready to sew machine.
customer_reviews.text: I love this sewing machine. It came threaded and was already to go. I plugged it in, turned it in and was ready to sew. I haven't sewn a lot. In the past, I have made a few things. I had sewing classes in middle school, but it's been a while. I bought this sewing machine to shorten some curtains I recently bought. I'm planning on making pillows with the left over material. Its a perfect machine for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't sewn for about 20 years but since there was a need for masks during the Cronavirus, I am now back into sewing. Fortunately, I purchased this machine right before the virus hit and before they were harder to get because of the demand. I love this little machine. It was easy to set up and I found by watching youtube videos, it was easier to thread and use instead of the written instructions. After I do the masks I will attempt curtains. That was the reason I decided to order one but it seems like it was meant to be for the masks, which there are such a need for.
customer_reviews.author: Judy P.

customer_reviews.title: Handy little machine
customer_reviews.text: I love the machine. It’s small, lightweight, and easy to use. My only problem with it is the lack of an instruction manual. The paper showing how to thread it was pictures only and confusing.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia B

customer_reviews.title: Bobbin jam
customer_reviews.text: This machine is great for beginners, basic options and easy to use. That said, EVERY TIME I set it up to use, I was never able to complete project because the bobbin would jam. Of course, I removed the thread and bobbin to clean out the left over pieces of thread and reinstalled both. Again, it would jam. I watched numerous vids on how to resolve this issue AND STILL JAMMED. So, not sure if it is "operator error" or the machine. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffs York

customer_reviews.title: Great small machine
customer_reviews.text: I loved this little bruiser. I had not bought a sewing machine in at least 30 years. I had no idea they made them so functional. Though it is difficult for me as my eyes get older to be able to see to thread this is not the fault of the machine. I loved how quiet, the stitches are easy to adjust . I got a little confused about the direction of threading but went to the You Tube video and there it was. Great machine for the low price. I highly recommend, this machine, great quality for such a little price. Way better than my grandmothers old machine.
customer_reviews.author: Mamma J

customer_reviews.title: A great machine
customer_reviews.text: What a great sewing machine. A little smaller than full size, but with all the power of a larger machine. I tried one of those mini machines and it was so worthless, I sent it back and purchased this one which happened to be on sale for a great price. Boy did it make the job easy. Instructions are easy to follow ( I watched a little video before I even received the machine). It came pre-threaded which was nice and I love that it has a reverse button, which a lot of the smaller machines do not have. I would definitely recommend this machine for just a basic inexpensive machine. It would be great for a beginner too
customer_reviews.author: rita fr louisville KY

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this Singer product. The stitches keep getting tangled up/ I get it straightened out/ then it messes up again. FRUSTRATING
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Zeyher

customer_reviews.title: Think this machine was used
customer_reviews.text: The bobbin was already threaded, there is another bobbin threaded where the thread would go and no instruction manual. Appears this machine was used before and returned. Not happy
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn R

customer_reviews.title: Not a good machine for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I returned this machine. I am an experienced sewer. My machine broke and I couldn't afford another good one so I got this. I struggled to load the bobbin and thread the machine. The foot is not adjustable so it is not intended for thick fabric or layers. This may be good for an absolute beginner to use - but the threading and loading of bobbin are arduous tasks. Plus loading the bobbin required taking off the part of the machine - not very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: kelly

customer_reviews.title: Wasted money for a trash
customer_reviews.text: I honestly wasted my whole money for nothing. Sewing is my hobby and I am an experience little tailor. I have brought this machine about one month and few days ago and now this matchine stoped working. I tried to open it and showed to other people to fix it but no can do anything about it. Now I can’t even return it or fix it. I literally wasted my whole money for a piece of trash. I wouldn’t recommend this to anyone because it literally waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Threading issues
customer_reviews.text: I really love the sewing machine. I purchased it to start sewing face masks and to start beginner sewing projects in general. It is easy to use, but I have a lot of issues with the thread suddenly "not being threaded correctly" and then it jams up my project. I have to take the project off, use a seam ripper, and then rethread the whole machine again. Not sure what I could possibly be doing that would cause this to happen, but it happens frequently. I am going to chalk it up to me still being a newbie but that is why it is minus one star.
customer_reviews.author: Lazypuppergaming

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t perform
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine because While I know how to sew it’s been years since I had a machine. This machine wouldn’t stitch properly without adjusting the bobbin case. Once I resolved that issue the upper thread chase would jam the machine, as a result of getting the thread out of the mechanism and now the needle is striking the bobbin housing. I’m extremely disappointed in Singer. I purchased in early March but just opened the box to use it and now the return window has closed. I should have checked it when I got it but it came factory sealed so I didn’t anticipate a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Claudette Z

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Total piece of crap. I was looking for an easy machine for hemming curtains. The machine is incredibly lightweight. So much so that it bounces when sewing and the needle moves or it jams. I hope your mechanical because I took it apart and reesembled multiple time. I broke all the flimsy needles by my second project. Again, just curtains; lightweight cotton curtains. Complete waste of money
customer_reviews.author: patrick

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my granddaughter and it was way too difficult for her to even get started.(bobbins and threading the needle) It was for her birthday and I ordered it early- By the time I found out it was too difficult for her, I was past the return window. Now I’m stuck with it. I ordered her a second machine specifically for kids and that one is much better.
customer_reviews.author: All Things Heart and Home

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: I like the uncomplicated use of this machine. I have been sewing for years and this is one of the best machines. It is easy to use and easy to set up. Have had expensive machines with all the bells and whistles and they would not sew properly. Thought I would go back to a singer. You can't beat the quality. I learned to sew on a singer tredle machine sure wished I had that old machine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good machine for basic sewing
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this little sewing machine to have at our winter home. It is compact and easy to store. Instructions for filling the bobbin were easy to follow. The stitching is smooth, even, and the dial for selection easy to use. Would recommend it for anyone doing quick, easy projects.
customer_reviews.author: Oregon Native

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect for the price and limited use I will use ...
customer_reviews.text: I donated my sewing machine 6 years ago and found I missed having a machine for the simple repairs, etc. that I do. This is perfect for the price and limited use I will use it for. My first project was to finish a Christmas stocking for my son which required sewing through several layers of fabric to add the piping. The machine's tension was difficult to get adjusted to what would work. But for normal sewing I think it will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: B Howard

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: I got rid of all my sewing machines years ago but found that I needed a nice compact machine that that was easy to store when not in use. Sometimes you just need a machine that does all the basic stuff for small repairs. This machine fit the bill!
customer_reviews.author: nicole

customer_reviews.title: comes already threaded
customer_reviews.text: For beginners the hardest thing to learn is to rethread the under bobbin, but this comes pre-threaded top and bottom and there is perfect for a novice who wants to get started right away. It's also the easiest machine I have ever used. I highly recommend this for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Hamlin

customer_reviews.title: If you need practice threading machines over and over this is for you
customer_reviews.text: It CONSTANTLY unthreads itself.. I've had a couple durable sewing machines that have lated me 10 years and I'm over this one after 2 weeks. Proof that you should invest more money in things if you want them to function
customer_reviews.author: Angel face

customer_reviews.title: nice machine
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 12 tr old granddaughter. She could use it in only a few minutes. She had a much cheaper model last year. This is far better. I would buy it again if needed. Only 4 stars because instructions aren't very good.
customer_reviews.author: john heath

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality for a Singer!
customer_reviews.text: As advertised the machine was light and easy to begin using. However the bobbin and shuttle timing should NOT break the first time it is used. I bought this for simple straight stitch and zigzag sewing on light fabrics and it worked on a straight stitch for 10 minutes then the mechanism that controlled the side mounted bobbin froze. I've been sewing for many years on various machines and NEVER had a machine do this. It was very disappointing for a brand new Singer. I returned the machine and ordered a Singer Heavy duty model with a top drop in bobbin. Hope it works!
customer_reviews.author: Deb Palo Alto

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: This is a crappy piece of machine. The thread tangles up in the bobbin area all the time and then locks up with the stitching a huge mess. Throwing this piece of crap out with the garbage!
customer_reviews.author: riogirl

customer_reviews.title: Spend more $ for a better quality machine!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine for my 8 year old for Christmas. I wish I had upgraded to something better. It constantly comes unthreaded, skips stitches, will only sew two pieces of fabric at a time, will only do a straight stitch (not a zig zag), etc., etc. It's been nothing but a disappointment. Unfortunately, we just started using it because I didn't have time to sit down with her to learn together.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa P

customer_reviews.title: A used machine arrived  UPDATED REVIEW
customer_reviews.text: 2nd review Replacement Singer arrived quickly and was new without any problems. Followed YouTube videos on operation. Machine is great. I only needed a machine for straight sewing and it works perfectly. Suggestion would be include a manual with the Singer...my husband printed one for future use. 1st review Disappointed in the product sent to us. It was a return from someone else...bobbin in machine, threaded, no booklet or accessories in box. Box was obviously opened and resealed. Am waiting now on a new machine and will evaluate again after we actually get to use it.
customer_reviews.author: MNO

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. St
customer_reviews.text: By no means am I a professional at sewing. I bought this machine just to try a new thing in my life. It was my first time ever using a sewing machine. I thought it would be so much harder to use. It is honestly was very easy, the instructions are very clear. It is a very good machine for me as a beginner just trying to learn. The stiches are also nice, a person could do so much with them.
customer_reviews.author: Husam Aldeen ALshloul

customer_reviews.title: Great for our 8 year old daughter!
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter loves this machine! She is a beginner and was able to catch on rather quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Barbra C. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Broke in first month of use
customer_reviews.text: Within one month of use the machine broke. We had a sewing specialist come put and look at it and she cluldn’t Fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my old Brothers machine
customer_reviews.text: I love the simplicity of this machine. It is easy to operate and lightweight. It replaced a Brothers model and I'm much happier. Singer is a brand that I grew up with and the quality still seems to be there. Great machine for learning small projects and for those who have limited sewing skills.
customer_reviews.author: Martha H

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what I needed. Replace my big 30 year old machine. Price was right.
customer_reviews.text: Plugged it in and started sewing my projects. It is light weight, easy to use and perfect for my crafts and mending.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use but quit working on the third day of use.
customer_reviews.text: The machine broke three days after we began using it. Amazon sent a replacement asap.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy W

customer_reviews.title: I am sewing!
customer_reviews.text: The is the best beginners sewing machine. It’s easy to setup and light weight. There enough stitch settings to build the sewing skills of anyone. Price exceptionally reasonable. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Mague Elena Toles

customer_reviews.title: MCHINE JAMMED ON THE FIRST FOUR STITCHES!
customer_reviews.text: I am an experienced seamstress. I bought this for my grand daughter. As she is not experienced, I tried it out before I sent it to her. MACHINE JAMMED ON THE FIRST FOUR STITCHES! iT WILL NOT UN JAM. VERYDISSAPOINTED.
customer_reviews.author: E.T.

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for beginners
customer_reviews.text: My daughter got this for Christmas. She’s 9 so it was hard for her to start on her own but her grandma helped her. She was able to use the machine with her help and loved it. Directions are hard to follow, even for me as an adult (who has never seen before). I think we’ll watch some you tube videos to help us learn!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal N. Keckler

customer_reviews.title: Find the tutorial videos, get sewing!
customer_reviews.text: Love this as my first sewing machine. I found tutorials online through YouTube that helped guide me and now I'm very comfortable with using the machine.
customer_reviews.author: Amandalorian Fett

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I have never sewn in my life and this thing was super easy to learn. There are so many YouTube videos on how to wind the bobbin and how to thread the needle etc. I have had it for several months and have had no issues! Sure, I have gotten the thread stuck a few times in the under compartment but once you work with it a while you get the hang of it!! Would recommend to beginners. I use it to make dog bandannas and bow ties. Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Watch out!
customer_reviews.text: I got the machine and there were no written instructions for step by step to help understand what to do. The diagrams were awful so after a few days my husband and I finally figured it out. If you do buy this I strongly suggest you to look at youtube for help!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Jams a lot, back stitch don’t work but over all okay
customer_reviews.text: My machine has been okay to learn how to sew dresses, but WARNING the back stitch lever does not work and break my needle everytime, I am so upset I can’t finish my dress and I have to buy a new more expensive machine, it jams up a lot but over all it is okay
customer_reviews.author: Kai

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine, seems to do all the basics very well.
customer_reviews.text: Great little machine, nice and strong. The needle that comes with it is not though, suggest you put a stronger needle in right away.
customer_reviews.author: Steven C. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! This is the first sewing machine I’ve ever sewn on and I found it super easy to figure out. Singer also has YouTube instructional videos for this model which helped a lot. The day I got it I made a throw pillow cover out of an old scarf for fall and it came out perfectly! It’s definitely basic, but that’s exactly what I needed. Would definitely recommend to anyone starting out!
customer_reviews.author: lauren

customer_reviews.title: Great Starter Sewing Machine
customer_reviews.text: I hate sewing however it may have been I never had the right machine until now. The machine is easy to tread and setup however I would recommend you going on YouTube to watch the videos on setup because the instructions included skip important steps and things you need to do to get your machine running right. After setup, it runs great. I would highly recommend to anyone trying to get into sewing.
customer_reviews.author: Ashes

customer_reviews.title: i will not recommend this model
customer_reviews.text: This is not what I expected. it started to make noise in two weeks and now thread gets in in bobbin parts and jams up the whole machine. no matter how many times I clean it doesn't work. jams again and again. i wish I could return it.
customer_reviews.author: happybird

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Immediately needed to take machine in for repair because needle would not move.😕
customer_reviews.author: diane millican

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Very Good, love using it and it was very well packed and it was already to go. I love my Singer Start 1304
customer_reviews.author: D. Chown

customer_reviews.title: would not sew from the beginning. I had it ...
customer_reviews.text: would not sew from the beginning. I had it sent to my daughters address so I would have the machine when I came down to Phoenix in March. i set it up on Mr.13 and could not make it work. Now I find I can't even return it. What a bummer!
customer_reviews.author: linda hindmarch

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. Filling the bobbin is difficult, threading the machine is difficult. I have 50 years of experience, after my old Singer gave up the ghost I thought I'd go with this simple version. After exactly one line of stitching, the needle jammed up and won't move. It's going back. I'd give it -0- stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie S

customer_reviews.title: Simple
customer_reviews.text: I learned to sew at 48 using this my seam stress mom could not teach me my entire life. Add a YouTube video for support
customer_reviews.author: tiahnna ross-haskins

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I bought myself this Singer 1304 sewing machine to fix all my jeans that are too long to wear. I've never own one, but my mom did. I kind of had an idea about how to use it. hmmm. So, yesterday I used it for the first time. I watched a tutorial online, set it up and my first jeans project is done! The needle was sturdy enough to sew on thicker parts of the fabric. It was very gentle, not too loud, and the stitches are really pretty on my jeans. I'm ready for my second project!! Thank you! This machine is a must have!
customer_reviews.author: C.S.

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Product did not work. The bobbin keeps popping up and when it doesn’t, the stitch is loose. Kept tightening and did not improve. My daughter is devastated that her present does not work. We are frustrated from spending hours on this and not working properly.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne A. Engo

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Kind of disappointed, and very frustrated! Singer is supposed to be a good brand, but it keeps jamming on me and skipping stitches. Sewing is not fun on this machine. I've done everything by the book and don't know why it's not working right. It did at first, but not now. I can't afford an expensive machine. I don't sew very often. I just like it for occasional projects.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Young

customer_reviews.title: Nice, basic machine
customer_reviews.text: Basic machine for simple non-decorative stitching. Lighter weight than some machines, and if you have previously used Singer machines, not much has changed. You do need a light touch on the foot pedal, so you will need to practice to get the hang of it. Drawbacks: the manual was on-line only, and the storage compartment is not easy to detach from the machine (I will just leave it off in the future). Also, the twin spools are not really useful, as there is no twin-needle accessory included or instructions for how it's used in the manual. Still, I am generally pleased with this purchase for simple sewing.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin O'Malley

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine!
customer_reviews.text: I had not sewed in almost 18 years so I was hesitant to put a lot of money into a new machine. This little one works perfect for small projects. I watched a few YouTube videos specific to this one that were very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Very basic
customer_reviews.text: Does everything I need it to do. Wouldn't recommend it for someone who sews a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sews beautifully.
customer_reviews.text: Sews beautifully. Lighting is an excellent feature. Foot pedal would be better if made of heavier product and little longer cord. I would recommend this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: awesome machine! I love it
customer_reviews.text: great machine for the money, just be sure to use a good thread so no jam ups. I wish I knew that in the past. I bought 3 spools of high quality all purpose thread about 9 dollars each, black grey and blue and this should cover all of my sewing needs
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Robertson

customer_reviews.title: For simple projects with a smile
customer_reviews.text: I am a beginner in sewing and I have only sewn straight stitches for curtains or pillow cases. My old sewing machine broke so I bought this machine which is just right up my ally in price and for what simple projects I have. I am so content with this machine as it is so easy to operate. It is so light and small that I can take it anyway I go.
customer_reviews.author: Kukana

customer_reviews.title: Machine gets jammed all the time
customer_reviews.text: This sewing machine claimed to be for beginners. I watched the video to set it up and it worked great. One minute later the thread got jammed and tangled even thought I was using it correctly. Had to take it apart to untangle the thread from the inside and it’s been happening ever since.
customer_reviews.author: J Dawg

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: This is a great starters machine. I had no experience sewing and this helped my feet get wet in the field. I'd definitely recommend for any newbie or if you need a sewing machine for small simple projects.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needles keep breaking but otherwise a good machine
customer_reviews.text: This is a great machine except needles keep breaking during use and the thread unthreads itself from time to time. It could just be a beginner issue but something tells me you get what you bargain for if you know what I mean.
customer_reviews.author: jessica miavon hackman

customer_reviews.title: Cheap!
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on this cheap machine. I wanted to sew next to my 9 year old daughter. She always wants to use my sewing machine when I have it out. I thought it would be fun for both of us to sew together. This machine is mare work than fun. The bobbin gets stuck all of the time, it's not powerful enough to get through all fabrics. I would buy a full size machine and not waste my time on this one. I will be donating soon!
customer_reviews.author: Judy Golden

customer_reviews.title: Bobbin winder broken out of box
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box the bobbin winder won’t wind. Ridiculous. Have had it too long to return. There’s even a burning smell so something is obviously off.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for Beginners!
customer_reviews.text: The sowing machine is very easy to maintain. Only complications I came across was trying to get the thread and bobbin inside the machine. It sometimes jams, but after a couple of cleanup methods it flows. Overall, a very easy machine to work and there are a lot of Youtube videos out on the machine that is very helpful for a beginner! I would recommend this purchase for beginners like me!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR BEGINNERS
customer_reviews.text: My 18 yr old bought this so she could learn to sew. 3 of us in the household and not one could figure out how to set up the machine. The instructions were not user friendly. we returned.
customer_reviews.author: tonya t

product_meta.title: SINGER, 57 Applications-Perfect Made Easy | Start 1304 6 Built-in Stitches, Free Arm Best Sewing Machine for Beginners
product_meta.description:
The SINGER Start 1304 sewing machine is a basic, simple, and easy-to-use mechanical sewing machine. It is a good choice for beginners thanks to 6 Built-in Stitches, all with pre-set stitch width and stitch length. Just select your stitch and start sewing. The SINGER Start 1304 Free Arm sewing machine comes with a limited 25 Year Warranty. This Free Arm sewing machine has a ton of other features like easy stitch selection, automatic bobbin winding system, free arm, built-in reverse, easy threading, adjustable tension settings, and extra-high presser foot lifter.

PRODUCT DETAIL:
Weight: 11.5 pounds.
Dimensions: 13 x 7 x 11.5 inches.
Stitches: 5-millimeter stitch width, and 6 built-in stitches: straight, zigzag, satin, blind hem, scallop, and a 4-step buttonhole.
Speed: 350-400 stitches per minute.
Bobbin: Class 15
Warranty: 25 years limited.
Feet Type Included: All-Purpose Foot, Zipper Foot, Buttonhole
Foot Presser Foot System: Low bar
Color Family: White
Item Weight (lbs.): 11.5
Button Holes: 4-Step
Number of Built-In Stitches: 6
Number of Decorative Stitches: 1
Number of Styles: 6
Stitch Width Control: Fixed
feature_bullets: BEST SEWING MACHINE: The SINGER Start 1304 sewing machine is basic, simple, and easy-to-use thanks to 57 Stitch Applications, all with pre-set stitch width and stitch length. Just select your stitch and start sewing
: SINGER Start 1304 Start Free Arm Model Sewing Machine has 25 Year Limited
LIGHTWEIGHT AND PORTABLE: This lightweight and portable machine weighs only 7 pounds, making it great for sewing in smaller spaces or taking to sewing class

AUTOMATIC BOBBIN WINDING SEWING MACHINE: To wind a bobbin, simply follow the numbered diagram printed on top of the sewing machine. The bobbin will automatically stop turning when it's completely filled

SINGER Start 1304 ACCESSORIES: Includes All-Purpose Foot, Zipper Foot, Buttonhole Foot, Darning Plate, Pack of Needles, Bobbins, Needle Plate Screwdriver, Spool Pin Felts, Seam Ripper / Lint Brush, Power Line Cord, Foot Control, Quick Start Guide, Instruction Manual. Amps: 0. 6
This sewing machine is warranted for use in the US and Canada at 110 volts only
